ai.summary: A demanding 21.3 km hike along Firmounth Road in the UK, best suited for experienced walkers seeking a strenuous day on mixed terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines road sections with field paths, muddy tracks and intermittent rough terrain. Expect long stretches on uneven footing, some gentle gradients and occasional boggy or knee-deep areas after rain. Weather can change quickly in the UK, and parts of the route may be exposed with limited shelter.
ai.safety_notes: - Weather can change rapidly; check forecasts and avoid extreme conditions. - The route includes long stretches with few facilities; carry sufficient water and snacks. - Footing can be uneven and slippery; wear sturdy waterproof boots and consider trekking poles. - Navigation can be challenging in poorly marked sections; carry a map and compass and ensure your phone has a backup power source. - Let someone know your plans and expected return time; have a backup plan for turning back.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate layers (base, insulating layer, waterproof outer layer)
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Water container (2–3 L) and high-energy snacks
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (approximately March to October) are generally best; winter hikes are possible with advanced planning and gear.

seo.title: Firmounth Road – 21.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the challenging 21.3 km Firmounth Road hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, essential gear, and the best seasons for this strenuous route.
